intro: Pulicaria balansae, commonly known as the Balansae groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers and hairy stems. The plant belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts. It typically thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to the arid climate of its native habitat. Its botanical features make it a unique and resilient species within its ecological niche.
